alert.note: Alert for Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 02 at 1:11AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM AST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mainly along the Rio Cibuco and associated tributaries in Vega Baja. * WHEN...Until 415 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 111 AM AST, Excessive runoff from previous heavy rains continue to affect rivers and streams in this area. Local emergency manager reported that Rio Cibuco continued at high levels as well as the USGS river sensors in that area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen with the previous heavy rains. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Rio Indio, Rio Cibuco_and all tributaries. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
